topic: How to deploy WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to deploy WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deploying WebAssembly (WASM) targets using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a step-by-step walkthrough on deploying WebAssembly (WASM) targets in conjunction with FastAPI for web applications, utilizing Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the basics of WebAssembly and its benefits
Setting up a FastAPI project with Python 3.12+
Preparing WASM modules using Emscripten or other tools
Integrating WASM modules into FastAPI applications
Optimizing the deployment process for optimal performance

code_examples.code: // Emscripten-compiled C++ code for WASM module

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this guide, as it includes improvements related to WebAssembly support
FastAPI version should be compatible with the chosen Python version
caveats: Ensure that your development environment supports WebAssembly and has Emscripten or other WASM tools installed
Properly handle any dependencies required by your WASM modules during deployment
